title: Back to basics with SAP Cloud Application Programming Model (CAP) - part 1
description:
Let's kick off our series of live streams in 2024 with something that's been much requested - a back to basics series on CAP with Node.js!

See https://community.sap.com/t5/sap-community/back-to-basics-with-sap-cloud-application-programming-model-cap-part-1/ev-p/310513 for all resource links.

*Summary*
Made with HARPA AI

- [03:40](https://youtu.be/gu5r1EWSDSU?t=220s) üéâ Introduction to the live stream in 2024
  - DJ Adams welcomes viewers to the first live stream of 2024.
  - He acknowledges the audience and talks about his recent flu.
  - DJ Adams introduces his new location, a narrow boat, and shows the setup.

- [07:54](https://youtu.be/gu5r1EWSDSU?t=474s) üì∫ Overview of the series and setup for local development
  - DJ Adams discusses the new series focusing on SAP Cloud Application Programming Model (CAP).
  - He explains the goal of going back to basics and helping viewers understand CAP.
  - DJ Adams outlines the minimal requirements for following along, which are VS Code and a container engine.

- [27:35](https://youtu.be/gu5r1EWSDSU?t=1655s) ü§ñ Difference between a service and an app in CAP:
  - Understanding the distinction between services and apps in CAP.
  
- [28:06](https://youtu.be/gu5r1EWSDSU?t=1686s) üõ°Ô∏è Installing necessary development tools for CAP:
  - Installing curl, git, and SQL light 3, essential tools for CAP development.
  
- [28:52](https://youtu.be/gu5r1EWSDSU?t=1732s) üíº Introduction to npm and SAP npm packages:
  - Explaining npm as a package manager for Node.js and SAP npm packages for CAP development.
  
- [29:34](https://youtu.be/gu5r1EWSDSU?t=1774s) üöÄ Difference between SAP CDs and SAP CDs DK:
  - Distinguishing between SAP CDs (runtime) and SAP CDs DK (development kit) for CAP development.
  
- [30:14](https://youtu.be/gu5r1EWSDSU?t=1814s) üåê Overview of CAP development hierarchy:

  - Exploring the hierarchy of CAP development folders: app, serve, and DB.
  
- [31:10](https://youtu.be/gu5r1EWSDSU?t=1870s) üì¶ SAP Cloud Application Programming Model (CAP) packages:
  - Understanding the purpose of SAP CAP packages for runtime and development.
  
- [32:08](https://youtu.be/gu5r1EWSDSU?t=1928s) üîÑ The role of npm packages in CAP development:
  - Highlighting the significance of npm packages for CAP development.
  
- [33:41](https://youtu.be/gu5r1EWSDSU?t=2021s) üîå Exposing Port 404 for CAP development:
  - Explaining the importance of exposing Port 404 for accessing CAP applications locally.
  
- [47:29](https://youtu.be/gu5r1EWSDSU?t=2849s) üß∞ Setting up CAP development environment in VS Code:
  - Demonstrating how to set up a CAP development environment using VS Code and Dev Containers.
  
- [49:25](https://youtu.be/gu5r1EWSDSU?t=2965s) üöÄ Installing development tools in the container:
  - Highlighting the installation of essential development tools inside the Dev Container for CAP development.

- [50:36](https://youtu.be/gu5r1EWSDSU?t=3036s) üõ†Ô∏è Setting up a development environment in a container.
  - Docker container setup with CAP and Node.js.
  - Exploring packages installed in the container.
  - Introduction to CD SDK.

- [52:12](https://youtu.be/gu5r1EWSDSU?t=3132s) üßô‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è The power of CAP with the CDs command line tool.
  - Explanation of using the CDs command line tool.
  - CAP development capabilities at your fingertips.
  - The benefits of a consistent development environment in a container.

- [54:53](https://youtu.be/gu5r1EWSDSU?t=3293s) üìö Back to basics with CAP - Multi-episode series.
  - Announcing a multi-episode series on CAP.
  - Exploring the basics of CAP together.
  - Encouraging viewer participation in learning CAP.

title: Back to basics with SAP Cloud Application Programming Model (CAP) - part 2
description:
In this episode 2 of our series, we continue to explore the basics of CAP with Node.js. This time we dig into the detail of what happens with cds init, cds add and cds watch. 

üåé See https://community.sap.com/t5/sap-community/back-to-basics-with-sap-cloud-application-programming-model-cap-part-2/ev-p/311695 for all resource links.

*Summary* 
Generated by AI

- [01:58] üëã Introduction and Greetings
  - DJ welcomes the audience and greets them.

- [02:23] üì∫ Episode Introduction
  - DJ introduces the second episode of the "Back to Basics with SAP Cloud Application Programming Model (CAP)" series.

- [03:19] üì± Experiment with Camera Setup
  - DJ explains an experiment with his camera setup and mentions his colleague AJ joining the session.

- [04:43] üó∫Ô∏è Series Overview and Approach
  - DJ outlines the series' purpose: a gentle exploration of CAP basics, emphasizing understanding.

- [05:25] üèÉ DJ's Health Update
  - DJ briefly updates on his health and mentions his morning run.

- [07:16] üì¶ Using Dev Containers with CAP
  - DJ talks about using development containers with CAP and mentions a blog post he wrote.

- [09:08] üì∞ SAP Developer News
  - DJ shares information about the SAP Developer News and mentions a blog post by Riley Rainey.

- [10:32] üí° Planning for the Session
  - DJ discusses the plan for the session, which includes exploring CAP commands.

- [12:06] üë©‚Äçüíª Opening VS Code and Dev Containers
  - DJ opens VS Code and explains the process of using Dev Containers.

- [13:15] ‚öôÔ∏è Exploring `cds init`
  - DJ explains the `cds init` command and its purpose in initializing a CAP project.

- [14:12] üí¨ Audience Discussion on Language Preferences
  - DJ briefly discusses language preferences, mentioning both Java and JavaScript.

- [16:04] üìÅ Directory Structure in Initialized Project
  - DJ explores the directory structure created by the `cds init` command.

- [17:23] ü§î Questions about `.eslintrc` and `.gitignore`
  - DJ asks the audience for insights into the purposes of `.eslintrc` and `.gitignore` files.

- [19:32] üîí Purpose of `.gitignore`
  - Stefano explains that `.gitignore` is used to specify files that should not be included in the Git repository.

- [20:58] üêö Overview of app components and local development
  - App components created on the local file system.
  - Development within a container context.
  - Importance of not storing data inside containers.

- [22:36] üìú Understanding git and GitHub
  - Differentiating between git and GitHub.
  - Explaining the purpose of .gitignore in ignoring files for git.
  - Highlighting the significance of not storing sensitive data in repositories.

- [26:10]üßπ Introduction to ESLint and linting in JavaScript
  - Discussing ESLint as a linting tool for JavaScript.
  - Explaining the role of ESLint in catching compile-time errors and enforcing code style.
  - Mentioning the importance of setting rules for code quality.

- [29:56] üöÄ Integration of ESLint with SAP CAP
  - Introducing the integration of ESLint with SAP Cloud Application Programming Model (CAP).
  - Highlighting the purpose of ESLint rules specific to CAP development.
  - Exploring how ESLint checks CAP code against defined rules.

- [32:41] üìÅ Explanation of RC Files and Hidden Files
  - Clarifying the historical significance of RC files in Unix.
  - Describing the naming convention of RC files for configuration.
  - Discussing the use of hidden files (files starting with a dot) in Unix-like systems.

- [38:08] üìÇ Understanding the Purpose of 'DB' and 'Serve' Directories in CAP
  - Explaining the purpose of 'DB' and 'Serve' directories in SAP CAP.
  - Distinguishing between the persistence layer (DB) and service layer (Serve).
  - Highlighting the need for separation in defining entities, services, and data exposure in CAP.

- [41:04] üì¶ Overview of project structure
  - Project structure includes directories like `db`, `srv`, `app`, and others.
  - CDS language encourages reusable and modularized definitions for projects.
  - Explanation of directories like `cds`, `eslintrc`, and `package.json`.

- [43:06] üìù Understanding package.json
  - Package.json contains project metadata, dependencies, and scripts.
  - Differentiating between dependencies and dev dependencies.
  - The significance of the "scripts" section, including "npm start" for starting the service.

- [46:05] üõ†Ô∏è Design time vs. runtime dependencies
  - Explains the difference between design time and runtime dependencies.
  - Design time tools like watchers and auto restarters are not needed in production.
 
- [49:45] üß© Adding features with "CDS add"
  - Demonstrates how to add features to a project using "CDS add."
  - Shows the addition of a tiny sample feature and its impact on the project structure.

- [55:44] üßπ Linting with "CDS lint"
  - Introduces linting for a CAP project using "CDS lint."

- [01:02:55] üóÉÔ∏è Locating the global installation of SAP CDS DK
  - Explains how to find the global installation path of SAP CDS DK.

title: Back to basics with SAP Cloud Application Programming Model (CAP) - part 3
description:
In this episode 3 of our series, we continue to explore the basics of CAP with Node.js. We pick up where we left off last time, and investigate starting up a basic CAP server with cds watch to discover the amazing features that it gives us. Everyone welcome, especially beginners, come and join us for friendly chat and curiosity-driven learning-by-doing!

See https://community.sap.com/t5/sap-community/back-to-basics-with-sap-cloud-application-programming-model-cap-part-3/ec-p/13582522#M410 for all resource links.
caption: false

title: Back to basics with SAP Cloud Application Programming Model (CAP) - part 4
description:
In this episode 4 of our series, we continue to explore the basics of CAP with Node.js, digging deeper into cds watch and how we can manage our CDS definitions. Everyone welcome, especially beginners, come and join us for friendly chat and curiosity-driven learning-by-doing!

See https://community.sap.com/t5/sap-community/back-to-basics-with-sap-cloud-application-programming-model-cap-part-4/ec-p/13600391/highlight/true#M434 for all resource links.
caption: false

title: Back to basics with SAP Cloud Application Programming Model (CAP) - part 5
description:
In this episode, we look more into basic CDS service and entity definitions, and dig into aspects, types, CDS compilation to EDMX and SQL, and look at how we get a fully fledged OData V4 service, with all the OData operations handled, with no effort. Everyone welcome, especially beginners, come and join us for friendly chat and curiosity-driven learning-by-doing!

See https://community.sap.com/t5/sap-community/back-to-basics-with-sap-cloud-application-programming-model-cap-part-5/ec-p/13600538#M436 for all resource links.
caption: false

title: Back to basics with SAP Cloud Application Programming Model (CAP) - part 6
description:
In this episode, we head back to our CDS definitions, stare at the cuid aspect and what it implies, and then start improving our Books and Authors entity definitions. Everyone welcome, especially beginners, come and join us for friendly chat and curiosity-driven learning-by-doing!

See https://community.sap.com/t5/sap-community/back-to-basics-with-sap-cloud-application-programming-model-cap-part-6/ec-p/13616909/highlight/true#M471 for all resource links.
caption: false

title: Back to basics with SAP Cloud Application Programming Model (CAP) - part 7
description:
In this episode, we look more closely at the Country type, and use that as a springboard to start exploring managed associations. Everyone welcome, especially beginners, come and join us for friendly chat and curiosity-driven learning-by-doing!

See https://community.sap.com/t5/sap-community/back-to-basics-with-sap-cloud-application-programming-model-cap-part-7/ec-p/13626739#M477 for all resource links.
caption: false

title: Back to basics with SAP Cloud Application Programming Model (CAP) - part 8
description:
In this episode, we can now turn our attention to understanding how to define a managed association for our own entities. Everyone welcome, especially beginners, come and join us for friendly chat and curiosity-driven learning-by-doing!

See https://community.sap.com/t5/sap-community/back-to-basics-with-sap-cloud-application-programming-model-cap-part-8/ec-p/13639548/highlight/true#M517 for all resource links.
caption: false

title: Back to basics with SAP Cloud Application Programming Model (CAP) - part 9
description: In this episode, we dig in a little more to the managed association based relationship we started to set up between our entities. Everyone welcome, especially beginners, come and join us for friendly chat and curiosity-driven learning-by-doing!
caption: false

title: Back to basics with SAP Cloud Application Programming Model (CAP) - part 10
description:
In this episode, we move from exploring associations towards compositions. What's the difference? How are they similar? What do they look like behind the curtain? Everyone welcome, especially beginners, come and join us for friendly chat and curiosity-driven learning-by-doing!

Links to all resources shared in this episode are listed here: https://community.sap.com/t5/sap-community/back-to-basics-with-sap-cloud-application-programming-model-cap-part-10/ev-p/13660463
caption: false

title: Back to basics with SAP Cloud Application Programming Model (CAP) - part 11
description:
In this episode, we continue our exploration and understanding of Compositions, looking at auto-exposure of composition targets, cascaded delete and more. Everyone welcome, especially beginners, come and join us for friendly chat and curiosity-driven learning-by-doing!

Links to all resources shared in this episode are to be found in the comments here: https://community.sap.com/t5/sap-community/back-to-basics-with-sap-cloud-application-programming-model-cap-part-11/ec-p/13668034#M538
caption: false

title: Back to basics with SAP Cloud Application Programming Model (CAP) - part 12
description:
In this episode, we finish off our look at Compositions with composition of Aspects, and then start to move towards an understanding of custom service implementations. Yes! JavaScript! But super gentle. Everyone welcome, especially beginners, come and join us for friendly chat and curiosity-driven learning-by-doing!

Links to all resources shared in this episode are to be found in the comments here: https://community.sap.com/t5/sap-community/back-to-basics-with-sap-cloud-application-programming-model-cap-part-12/ec-p/13675919#M544
caption: false

title: Back to basics with SAP Cloud Application Programming Model (CAP) - part 13
description:
In this episode we look at the difference between the different standard events for providing custom logic and start to add some logic of our own. Everyone welcome, especially beginners, come and join us for friendly chat and curiosity-driven learning-by-doing!

Links to all resources shared in this episode are to be found in the comments here: https://community.sap.com/t5/sap-community/back-to-basics-with-sap-cloud-application-programming-model-cap-part-13/ec-p/13690525
caption: false

title: Back to basics with SAP Cloud Application Programming Model (CAP) - part 15
description:
In this episode we look further into the 'after' handlers, dig in to how they work, look more into the 'each' mechanism and put an example together. Everyone welcome, especially beginners, come and join us for friendly chat and curiosity-driven learning-by-doing!

Links to all resources shared in this episode are to be found in the comments here: https://community.sap.com/t5/sap-community/back-to-basics-with-sap-cloud-application-programming-model-cap-part-15/ec-p/13717987#M570
caption: false

title: Back to basics with SAP Cloud Application Programming Model (CAP) - part 16
description:
In this episode we move back to the 'on' event and build a handler for a simple function. Everyone welcome, especially beginners, come and join us for friendly chat and curiosity-driven learning-by-doing!

Links to all resources shared in this episode are to be found in the comments here: https://community.sap.com/t5/sap-community/back-to-basics-with-sap-cloud-application-programming-model-cap-part-16/ec-p/13730760
caption: false

title: Back to basics with SAP Cloud Application Programming Model (CAP) - part 17
description:
In this episode we work on the implementation of the handler for our 'on' event, and dig in to some CQL. Everyone welcome, especially beginners, come and join us for friendly chat and curiosity-driven learning-by-doing!

Links to all resources shared in this episode are to be found in the comments here: https://community.sap.com/t5/sap-community/back-to-basics-with-sap-cloud-application-programming-model-cap-part-17/ec-p/13741241
caption: false

title: Back to basics with SAP Cloud Application Programming Model (CAP) - part 18
description:
Now that we're more comfortable with CQL and expressing it in the affordances that the CAP Node.js layer provides for us, we'll define and implement a second function, this time one that's bound to an entity. Everyone welcome, especially beginners, come and join us for friendly chat and curiosity-driven learning-by-doing!

Links to all resources shared in this episode are to be found in the comments here: https://community.sap.com/t5/sap-community/back-to-basics-with-sap-cloud-application-programming-model-cap-part-18/ec-p/13745651
caption: false

title: Back to basics with SAP Cloud Application Programming Model (CAP) - part 19
description:
In this episode we continue to understand and explore what we need to implement a bound function, looking at more complex destructuring, the bound entity context passed in the request, and more CQL. Everyone welcome, especially beginners, come and join us for friendly chat and curiosity-driven learning-by-doing!

Links to all resources shared in this episode are to be found in the comments here: https://community.sap.com/t5/sap-community/back-to-basics-with-sap-cloud-application-programming-model-cap-part-19/ec-p/13752449
caption: false

title: Back to basics with SAP Cloud Application Programming Model (CAP) - part 14
description:
In this episode we move from the 'on' to the 'after' handler concept, examine what such handler functions receive, and start to enhance the data returned. Everyone welcome, especially beginners, come and join us for friendly chat and curiosity-driven learning-by-doing!

Links to all resources shared in this episode are to be found in the comments here: https://community.sap.com/t5/sap-community/back-to-basics-with-sap-cloud-application-programming-model-cap-part-14/ec-p/13697489#M561
caption: false

title: Back to basics with SAP Cloud Application Programming Model (CAP) - part 20
description:
In this final episode of the series before the summer break, we finish off by defining and implementing a bound action, with a side effect. Everyone welcome, especially beginners, come and join us for friendly chat and curiosity-driven learning-by-doing!

Links to all resources shared in this episode are to be found in the comments here: https://community.sap.com/t5/sap-community/back-to-basics-with-sap-cloud-application-programming-model-cap-part-20/ec-p/13759023
